did.unittitle: Papers of Philos Cooke and Louise Stevens Cooke,

repository.label: Repository

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Papers of Philos Cooke and Louise Stevens Cooke, M0144, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Summary: Letters, postcards, pamphlets, and typescript biography. Includes correspondence of Fanny Chapman on Tahiti, material on Arizona's Constitutinal Convention, typescript biography of Louise
Stevens Cooke, material on Pitcairn Island, letter from Fred Christian, and writings by Theo Haultain about aborigines.

did.unittitle: Chapman - Cooke correspondence (Tahiti)
1. 1935 Sept. 20ans Frank Philos Cooke. Explanation background of Tahitian letters.
2. n.d.Postcard of Tiare Hotel
3. 1907, Apr. 30.A.L.S. cvr. 0. Salmon to Louise Stevens. Prices for guiding tourists.
4. 1925, Jan. 11.A.L.S. Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke. Personal, flu epidemic
5. 1925, Dec. 13.A.L.S. Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke
6. 1926, June 27.A.L.S Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke
7. 1926, Sept. 17A.L.S. Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke. Personal
8. 1926, Sept. 19.A.L.S. Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke
9. 1927, Sept. 12.A.L.S.Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke
10. 1927, Sept. 12.ALS Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke. Personal, leprosy.
11. 1927, Sept. 12.T.L.S. Scudder Mersman to Philos Cooke re: the Chapmans
12. 1927, Dec. 11.als Fanny Chapman to Louise Cooke
13. 1931, June 22.als Fanny Chapman to Philos Cooke. Death of Louise and Ben (in 1930)
Arizona Material
1. 1935. Dec. 15.tls James H. Kerby to Philos Cooke with ptd. "Minutes of the Constitutional Convention of the Territory of Arizona" comment by Cooke
2. 1936, Feb. 12."Louise Stevens Cooke, An American Woman, A story of some Re-incarnations in circumstances." Short typescript biography by Philos Cooke
Pitcairn Island
1. 1935, Jan 5.A.L.S Mr. Mrs. E.R. McCandlish to Philos Cooke
2. 1936, Jan. 6T.L. Philos Cooke to Fred M. Christian
3. 1936, Feb. 11.A.L.S. Fred M. Christian to Philos Cooke
4. n.d.Envelope with sewing machine needle
Haultain, Theo
1. Writings about aborigines; their culture - beliefs, legends, etc. a) "The Black Samaritan" b) "The Oldest Land"
